function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Vector-borne diseases and zoonotic diseases impacting tropical climates with inadequate access to health services","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emerging vector-borne diseases linked to neurological and developmental disorders in infants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Over-emphasis on technology and biomedical expertise","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underdeveloped thematic areas for vector-borne diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased vector densities and geographical spread due to climate change","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding the impacts of global change on vector-borne diseases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of attention to funding","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vector-borne diseases transmitted by multiple species of vectors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of climate change on vector populations","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ecosystem disturbances and biodiversity risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced biodiversity and range of reservoir hosts impacting trypanosomiasis infection","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate access to improved sanitation and drinking water","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impacts of water developments on
